intro: Matelea lanosa, commonly known as the woolly matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. Matelea lanosa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
